page.title: 19GOVERNMENT/COUNCILS,Headcorn
page.content: The area of land covered by this block to the East of{Headcorn Village}is governed by two different Borough Councils under the jurisdiction of{ {Kent County Council.}The South-Eastern side is bisected by the COUNTY COUNCIL BOUNDARY dividing{East}and{West Kent.} The East Kent section comes under {Ashford Council}and the larger portion is in the{Maidstone Borough District. Being in the middle of the Kentish Low Weald, this rural countryside is Grade III<Three> farmland and the Planning Officers study carefully any building plans submitted to them before allow- ing sny development, residential or otherwise,to go ahead.These rules also apply to any alterations and extension to existing buildings, so keeping a strict control on this rural area and conserving the{Green belt.
